intro: Peucedanum alsaticum subsp. venetum, commonly known as Italian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a notable component of its native habitats.
